instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928 stuck at 5v
threads.message:
UB400 -all LDOs except PP1V1 UPC TB LDO BMC
UB300 -all LDO s ok
U3100-all LDO s ok
U3200-all LDO s ok

threads.title: 820-00928 stuck at 5v
threads.message:
I reprogrammed UB090 still same
no water damage/corrosion
all resistance and traces looks fine

threads.title: 820-00928 stuck at 5v
threads.message:
You have a problem on UB400 area.
Did you change it?
Compare diode mode readings around it with other port.

Check diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H and post U7000 basic voltages; P_IN. AUX_DET, VDDA/P, SMC_RST_IN, EN_VR1, AUX_OK, A/BMON.
Also check SMC_USBC_INT_L level.
Tested with known good (charged) battery?
